snippet: If confirmed, this would be the first time a person has been cured with simple drug treatments, making a lifetime of antiviral therapy unnecessary.
abstract: Editorial holds that news of doctors apparently curing baby infected with HIV should be viewed cautiously; contends if case proves to be replicable, strong early treatment of HIV infection could become standard of care around world; warns that even if treatment works, prevention is best defense against mother-to-child transmission of HIV.
lead_paragraph: If confirmed, this would be the first time a person has been cured with simple drug treatments, making a lifetime of antiviral therapy unnecessary.
